p.s: Description of Solimonas variicoloris comb. nov.
Solimonas variicoloris (va′ri.i.co.lo′ris. L. adj. varius varying; L. gen. n. coloris of colour; N.L. gen n. variicoloris of varying colour).
Basonym: Singularimonas variicoloris Friedrich and Lipski 2008.

The description is as given for the genus Singularimonas and for Singularimonas variicoloris by Friedrich & Lipski (2008), with the addition that the type strain is facultatively anaerobic and forms long rod-shaped cells.

In addition to those given in the emended genus description, the polar lipids include phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine, two uncharacterized phospholipids and four further uncharacterized aminophospholipids.
The type strain, MN28T ( = DSM 15731T = LMG 22844T), was isolated from an industrial biofilter.
